terms.definition: Research and Development - the process of investigating, creating, and improving products or processes through scientific research and experimentation
A system that tracks and manages changes to documents or code over time, allowing users to access previous versions and see who made what changes
The systematic organization, storage, and maintenance of documents and information within an organization to ensure accessibility and compliance
A chronological record of all changes, access, and activities performed on documents or systems, providing transparency and accountability
Software as a Service - a cloud-based software delivery model where applications are hosted remotely and accessed via the internet
A single, unified system where all related data, documents, or processes are stored and managed from one location
The ability for multiple users to work on the same document or project simultaneously, with changes visible instantly to all participants
A pre-designed document format or structure that provides a standardized framework for creating consistent documentation
The process of adhering to laws, regulations, standards, and policies relevant to an organization's operations and documentation requirements
The protection of digital information from unauthorized access, corruption, or theft through various security measures and protocols
Security measures that determine who can view, edit, or manage specific documents or system resources based on user permissions
The use of technology to perform tasks or processes automatically without manual intervention, such as sending alerts or updating documents
Food and Beverage - refers to the industry sector that encompasses the production, processing, and distribution of food and drink products
Quality Assurance - systematic processes and procedures designed to ensure that products or services meet specified standards and requirements
The ability to track and document the history, location, and application of items or processes throughout their lifecycle for accountability and compliance purposes
